summary: Based on the principles of openness and accountability in government, the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requires federal agencies to give the public access to government records and information. The number of FOIA requests increased over 30% from fiscal year 2012 to 2018. In this period, the backlog of requests—generally those that have not been responded to in 20 business days—also increased. The backlog generally...
title: Freedom of Information Act: Federal Agencies' Recent Implementation Efforts
